note: Prices in USD per ADR (1 ADR = 5 ordinary shares). Financial data converted from NT$ at 32:1.

historical_growth.growth_divergence_warning: Historical growth very strong. FCF 5yr CAGR of 41% reflects operational leverage.

base.description: Management guidance achieved, strong execution continues

bull.description: AI super-cycle extends through 2030+, TSM maintains dominance

bear.description: AI demand moderates, geopolitical tensions increase

sensitivity.description: Intrinsic value per ADR under different WACC and terminal growth assumptions (Base Case projections)

interpretation.market_implies: Market is pricing in growth rates exceeding even the bull case, suggesting high expectations for AI super-cycle sustainability
key_insights: TSM trading at $326.12 vs Base Case IV of $188.42 (-42% downside)
Even in Bull Case (30% growth Y1-Y2, 38% FCF margins), IV is $299.37 (-8% downside)
Current P/E of 46.8x is significantly elevated for a semiconductor manufacturer
Probability-weighted IV of $200 suggests 39% downside risk from current levels
Entry price for 15% CAGR in Base Case is $115 (65% below current)
Market is pricing in sustained AI boom with minimal cyclical risk
risks: Geopolitical risk (Taiwan-China tensions) not fully priced in
AI demand cyclicality - any moderation would trigger severe multiple compression
Massive capex requirements ($50B+ annually) strain cash flow
Valuation leaves no margin of safety for execution missteps
catalysts_for_rerating: Continued AI accelerator demand exceeding 50%+ CAGR expectations
N2 (2nm) technology ramp ahead of schedule with premium pricing
Geographic diversification reducing Taiwan risk premium
Operating margin expansion from scale and advanced node mix

methodology_notes.fcf_margin_assumptions: FY2024 FCF margin of 30% reflects massive growth capex ($30B). Projections assume capex moderates as facilities come online, improving FCF margins to 28-38% range.
methodology_notes.wacc_justification: 9.5-12.5% range reflects geopolitical risk premium. Lower end assumes Taiwan tensions ease; higher end reflects current elevated risk.
methodology_notes.terminal_growth_rationale: 3-4.5% terminal growth reflects semiconductor industry growth plus TSM's technology leadership position enabling above-GDP growth.
methodology_notes.scenario_probabilities: Bull 30%, Base 50%, Bear 20% - weighted toward positive outcomes given TSM's execution track record and AI tailwinds, but with meaningful bear case probability.
methodology_notes.net_cash_benefit: $36.5B net cash position (negative net debt) adds value per share and provides buffer for capex.
